Articles.Content:
Are you tired of SAM's putting your Airforce out of service? Sick of that price tag on those Anti-SAM Fighters? Well do we have something for you! Introducing the Join Strike Fighters, a lower budget Anti-SAM multi role plane! There is even TWO to pick from! The first is a convintional layout that promises tight turning and reliability. The second is a radical layout that promices low budget. But dont just take my word for it! Try them both and see what you like. Best of all it is only FOUR thousand easy payments of one thousand dollars! Still not satisfied yet? Well take a look at the two in action!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

But wait there's more! Buy withen the next thirty seconds and recive our "smoke maker" for FREE!

Are you still not convinced? We will even throw in a VTOL Trainer for FREE!

That is a 2 million dallar value, yours for FREE!

Alright enough with the bad salesman me. The smoke maker is tested but the VTOL Trainer isnt the best so I wont release it. The two jets are also not like other JSF fighters on here. They are NOT replicas. They are my version also ment to keep parts down for stock and modded carrier operations. In VTOL mode the are NOT the best, what do you expect, Cupcake? I am nowhere near as good as he is so if you want a VTOL go check him out. Anyways good luck flying them. Here is a tip though, the are realistic in negative G's, don't pull much of 'em!

Action Groups(Both)

1 VTOL Engine

2 CTOL Engine

AF-32B https://www./?yxxz233jjl53n5v

AF-35B http://www./view/zb9038845r84w7y/AF-35B.craft

Smoke maker http://www./view/7h10necy69lcm4g/Smoke_Maker.craft

Edited February 23, 2014 by Jeb Cubed
Nice simple looking designs. Smooth lines, just need to work on the functionality a bit.

Acualy it is perfectly functional as a plane, and as a VTOL it isn't as maneuverable, but quite stable and can out turn a few planes on here. It has done every role it does in realy life in my testing very well. Of course that is to my standards but yours might be different. Mine are fairly high though.
